reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Lovely old hotel with furniture to match.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in room 11 which was supposed to have a private balcolny only to find the windows behind the balcolny were in fact the living room windows and anyone sat there could see you. We closed the shutters but whilst we were at dinner they were opened so not much privacy.
reviews.title: Lovely Old Hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was excellent and if you are allergic/or don't like anything please tell them when you arrive as they can prepare something different for you.
reviews.title: Charming but noisy and not customer oriented

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was cosy but a little overcrowded with furniture although the headboards were in need of replacing. Beds were comfy though even 3 pillows still weren't enough!
reviews.title: Lovely small family run hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel on a steep/sharp incline, bus stops are only a 5 min walk away and buses were every 10 minutes. Chillion Casle about a 15 min walk away.
reviews.title: good family run hotel with excellant food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent two nights at the hotel due to visiting the Montreux Jazz Festival. Although the building is not spectacular from the outside, the interior appears to be genuine 19th century style, with lots of antique furniture. The location is quiet and relaxing. The room was well equipped for a three star hotel, had a side view of the lake of Geneva including the top of Chillon castle and also of the motorway viaduct (there is only faint emission that does not disturb). The television screen is a bit small. No elevator, so if you have difficulties to climb stairways a ground floor room is recommended. A nice garden with deckchairs. Lovely lounge and terrace. Breakfast buffet good quality. Very friendly, helpful staff and management (owners). There is a private parking lot with limited space, and if the hotel is full, a parking place has to be found in the vicinity (there are a few but not many). The bus stop is a two minute walk downwards (upwards4 minutes, as quite steep). The bus takes about 5 minutes to the centre of Montreux and runs frequently.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel at nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in the hotel. The beds, linens and pillows were extremely uncomfortable, even for European 3 star standards. Breakfast was adequate. If you have difficulties walking up hill be aware that there is a fairly steep climb from the bus stop on the main road up to the hotel, and there are plenty of stairs in the hotel with no elevator. The office is up a flight of stairs as well. The garden is comfortable with lounge chairs and the location is just a short bus ride from the city center. The hotel provides a pass so you can ride the frequent and efficient bus system free.
reviews.title: Uncomfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beware: prices for everything not included in your room rate are outrageous, even compared to typical high prices we experienced at the other Switzerland hotels in which we stayed. Nearly 200 Swiss Francs for a few non alcoholic drinks from the mini bar and one dinner for 2 people.
reviews.title: Really nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was just right: the food, the staff, the interior. No luxury but nice. Relaxed and friendly atmosphere. I would love to visit Hotel Masson again.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended by family who live 5 min. away, so location was perfect for us. We arrived hours earlier than check-in time and owner accomodated us, even sent us breakfast after a long flight. Our room was downstairs, near the patio, which was great for the views and to sit outside to read & relax. Breakfast was very good, but as others have said, the staff speaks little English. Close to a tram stop and walking distance to the quai (walk by the river) and the Chateau de Chillon. Room was quaint and very clean. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: What a perfect find. Lovely staff, lovely food, lovely rooms need I say more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel. Excellent staff, service, accommodations & location. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a good variety. Very close to bus stop, and only moments from the heart of Montreux & train station by bus. It is a beautifully maintained & appointed historic hotel. The common balcony overlooks the lake & is quite beautiful. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Swiss Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Their website and the email I received imply that each room has a shower. They don't. We were put in a room that had only a tub in the bathroom, with a shower down the hall that could be used. I complained and we were moved to a room with a shower.
reviews.title: Shower OR tub, terrible Wi-Fi, some employees don't speak English

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Wi-Fi is absolutely terrible---extremely slow with frequent disconnections. They have what looks like a cheap, old, router sitting out in a hallway.
reviews.title: Clean and Friendly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The TV in the room is a 13 inch CRT that looks to be about 15 years old.
reviews.title: tranquil respite near busy mon treux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had dinner one night in their dining room; our waitress spoke absolutely no English. Some guests at the hotel were from Asia and other places around the world, and were speaking English. English is the common language of the world; it seems to me that all employees should speak some English.
reviews.title: Relax and enjoy the views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed here for 6 days in mid-August. I used it as a base to travel around the French-Swiss countryside. For the price, it was a great value. I stayed at four different hotels throughout my 2-week stay in Switzerland. It was not the fanciest, but definitely the most charming of the four. It also had the best breakfast of the four.
reviews.title: Great value and excellent customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was great, for my taste. It was outside Montreux in a residential area, away from the crowds, which I like (but if that's not your thing, then you choose someplace closer in). But it was easily accessible via Bus #1, which ran frequently and on time (I cannot rave enough about Swiss efficiency! Seriously.) and was a short 8 minute ride to the train station. The one major negative, however, was that the hotel was at the top of a very steep incline, which I know is a common occurrence seeing as how its Switzerland, but nonetheless, at the end of a long day touring the country, the last thing I wanted to do was to take that painful walk uphill and then climb 3 flights of stairs to get to my room! If you're only staying a couple of days, it'll be fine, but I was there for 6! It was quite a workout. However, the view of Lake Geneva from the hotel terrace more than made up for that walk! Plus, it was a stone's throw from the Chateau de Chillon, which is beautiful at sunset.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay good food & comfort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was small but clean and comfortable. It did get a little warm at night with no air conditioning and there was not much of a breeze outside, so a fan in the room would have been nice. (FYI, none of my hotels in Switzerland had AC.) Also, I would complain about the pillows having zero lift (I used 4 and still felt like I barely had one pillow), but that too was a common problem at all the hotels I stayed at in Switzerland.
reviews.title: would recommend this hotel to all like minded travellers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff were really friendly and took the time to know their guests. I particularly liked the dining room waitresses who were quiet and efficient, and remembered what you liked. So my breakfast table had the rolls and the butter I liked already there! (Little things like that go a long way when you're traveling by yourself.) The food was also quite good. It was typical of what I had at the other hotels I stayed in (rolls, cured meets, cheese, hard-boiled eggs, and cereal), but it was the best tasting. The rolls were fresh, the eggs were perfectly cooked, and best of all, it had the strongest coffee. I had dinner there twice, and although it was quite pricy, it was quite good. Food in general was the priciest part of Switzerland.
reviews.title: Fantastic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel to others. It's great as a quiet, but accessible location. However, I would recommend loosening those calf muscles, before staying here!
reviews.title: Such good service
